title: Got a compiler error, looks like incremental compilation. Hope this is useful

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Got a compiler error, looks like incremental compilation. Hope this is useful ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.59.0-beta.1 (7c0b25092 2022-01-13) binary: rustc commit-hash: 7c0b2509239eaaa55c203acbc4faebfde4c743c7 commit-date: 2022-01-13 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.59.0-beta.1 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output
Output with backtrace

``` ❯ RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo test Compiling iterapp v0.1.0 (/home/sindre/src/iterate/iterapp/iterapp) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 1162 but the index is 1163', compiler/rustc_query_impl/src/on_disk_cache.rs:726:18 stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/7c0b2509239eaaa55c203acbc4faebfde4c743c7/library/std/src/panicking.rs:498:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/7c0b2509239eaaa55c203acbc4faebfde4c743c7/library/core/src/panicking.rs:107:14 2: core::panicking::panic_bounds_check at /rustc/7c0b2509239eaaa55c203acbc4faebfde4c743c7/library/core/src/panicking.rs:75:5 3: >::decode 4: >::decode 5: ::read_seq::, as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode::{closure#0}> 6: >::decode 7: >::decode 8: <&rustc_middle::ty::TyS as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode 9: <&rustc_middle::ty::TyS as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode 10: as rustc_middle::ty::context::InternIteratorElement>>::intern_with::, <&rustc_middle::ty::list::List as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode::{closure#0}>, ::mk_substs, <&rustc_middle::ty::list::List as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode::{closure#0}>>::{closure#0}> 11: >::decode 12: <&rustc_middle::ty::TyS as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode 13: <&rustc_middle::ty::TyS as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode 14: as rustc_middle::ty::context::InternIteratorElement>>::intern_with::, <&rustc_middle::ty::list::List as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode::{closure#0}>, ::mk_substs, <&rustc_middle::ty::list::List as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode::{closure#0}>>::{closure#0}> 15: >::decode 16: <&rustc_middle::ty::TyS as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode 17: <&rustc_middle::ty::TyS as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode 18: ::read_map::>, > as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode::{closure#0}> 19: >::decode::{closure#0} 20: <&rustc_middle::ty::context::TypeckResults as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode 21: ::try_load_query_result::<&rustc_middle::ty::context::TypeckResults> 22: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_load_from_disk_and_cache_in_memory:: 23: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 24: ::typeck 25: ::visit_body 26: rustc_hir::intravisit::walk_expr:: 27: ::visit_expr 28: ::visit_expr 29: ::visit_expr 30: ::visit_expr 31: ::visit_body 32: rustc_hir::intravisit::walk_impl_item:: 33: ::visit_item_likes_in_module::> 34: rustc_passes::liveness::check_mod_liveness 35: >::with_task:: 36: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<((), rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job::{closure#3}> 37: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 38: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 39: as core::ops::function::FnOnce<()>>::call_once 40: ::time::<(), rustc_interface::passes::analysis::{closure#1}> 41: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 42: >::with_task::> 43: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<(core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>, rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job>::{closure#3}> 44: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::>> 45: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 46: ::enter::, rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> 47: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#1}> 48: rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}> 49: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.59.0-beta.1 (7c0b25092 2022-01-13) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental -C link-arg=-fuse-ld=lld --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [typeck] type-checking `facts::::get_encrypted_build_secrets::{closure#0}` #1 [check_mod_liveness] checking liveness of variables in module `facts` #2 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of
